intro: Theophrasta antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian theophrasta, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of western Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments and has woody stems with palmate leaves. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
